briefing.opening: Good morning/afternoon, everyone. We will now begin the climate briefing for February 15, 2026.

sections.title: ğŸ”´ Retreat in Global Climate Policy and Warnings from the International Community
sections.content: While calls for fulfilling climate change response obligations are growing louder within the international community, some major countries are observing policy retreats [13]. Specifically, the Trump administration's Environmental Protection Agency (EPA) withdrew findings that served as the scientific basis for U.S. climate change response, making decisions that limit climate change response authority [21, 23]. In response, California leaders voiced opposition and expressed concern over the Trump administration's reversal of historical decisions regarding greenhouse gas regulations [15]. This imbalance in international sentiment could act as a serious impediment to addressing the climate crisis.

sections.title: âš ï¸ Domestic Ecosystem Changes and the Paradox of the Carbon Neutrality Challenge
sections.content: Domestically, direct impacts of climate change on ecosystems are being observed. Warmer waters have been observed changing the breeding signals of frogs, causing them to produce mating calls more quickly, raising concerns about the restructuring of amphibian ecosystems [1]. Furthermore, in Hongseong County, South Chungcheong Province, last year saw a sharp decline in surf clam production due to extreme weather events like heatwaves, but this year's harvest has recovered, leading to a surge in demand. This clearly illustrates the profound impact of climate change on local specialty products [11]. Meanwhile, Stellantis's resumption of diesel car production due to a slump in the electric vehicle (EV) market represents a move counter to carbon neutrality goals, putting the climate response efforts of domestic industries to the test [3].

sections.title: ğŸŒ± Climate Action and Sustainable Efforts by Domestic Companies and Local Governments
sections.content: Amidst these crises, domestic companies and local governments continue their efforts to address climate change. Coca-Cola has initiated nature-based solutions (NBS) for climate crisis response by creating a 2-hectare coastal disaster prevention forest in the Pohang area [2]. Furthermore, telecommunication companies are emphasizing carbon neutrality practices as part of their ESG management, which includes supporting partners and volunteer activities, thereby striving for sustainable development [4]. Pyeongchang County and the County Facilities Management Corporation have signed an agreement to install renewable energy facilities in public parking lots, contributing to regional-level renewable energy transition [7].

sections.title: ğŸ“° Energy Transition Discussions and Warnings of Gradual Climate Change
sections.content: Domestically, deep contemplation on energy transition continues, with debates between nuclear power and renewable energy regarding the direction of energy policy returning to square one [6]. Amidst these discussions, the international community is issuing warnings about the gradual progression of climate change. Japan's 'godless' lake symbolically illustrates the slowly approaching dangers of climate change, urging us to take climate action from a long-term perspective [22, 25]. This reminds us that beyond immediate debates, the urgent establishment of fundamental solutions for future generations is paramount.

briefing.closing: This concludes today's climate briefing. International cooperation and proactive implementation, both domestically and internationally, are more crucial than ever in responding to the climate crisis. With that, we conclude today's climate briefing.

articles.description: Surf Clams. Provided by Hongseong County, Chungcheongnam-do. Hongseong surf clams are experiencing a nationwide surge in demand despite a recovery in production. This year, to mark the Lunar New Year holiday, various food festivals and experiential programs for family visitors are being held across regions such as Chungcheongnam-do and Sejong. According to Hongseong County, Chungcheongnam-do, the '23rd Hongseong Namdang Port Surf Clam Festival' will be held in the Namdang Port area of Seobu-myeon until the 22nd. Last year, due to abnormal climate conditions such as heatwaves, surf clam production sharply decreased, leading to 'new...'

summary.phenomenon: Last year, surf clam production in Hongseong County, Chungcheongnam-do, sharply decreased due to abnormal climate conditions, including heatwaves. Despite the recovery in production this year, nationwide demand is surging.
summary.cause: The sharp decrease in surf clam production was caused by abnormal climate phenomena, including heatwaves.
